claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: The image shows a journal article page header with dates (Received: 23 April 2023; Accepted: 19 December 2023; Published online: 04 January 2024) and a ‘Check for updates’ bar on the left. On the right is the introductory body text referencing influenza virus gene segments, egg-based vaccine generation processes (abbreviations like N0, HA), and variant designations, but no complete table or explicit data on mutations. does not support the claim because the visible text does not include any information or data indicating that cell- or egg-based flu vaccines develop mutations during production that reduce effectiveness. Note: The image is cut off and partial, with no clear table or mutation-specific content visible, limiting certainty.
